adana-kebap.description: A long, hand-minced meat kebab known for its spiciness.

kisir.description: A refreshing salad made with fine bulgur, parsley, and tomatoes.

gozleme.description: A savory Turkish flatbread filled with various toppings, sealed, and cooked over a griddle.
gozleme.history: A classic rustic food, its name comes from the Turkish word 'gÃ¶z' meaning eye.

simit.description: A circular bread, typically encrusted with sesame seeds and molasses.
simit.history: An iconic street food of Istanbul, its history dates back to the 16th century.

apple.description: A crisp and juicy fruit, eaten raw or used in a variety of dishes and drinks.
apple.history: Apples originated in Central Asia and have been cultivated for thousands of years.

banana.description: An elongated, edible fruit, botanically a berry, known for its high potassium content.
banana.history: Bananas are native to tropical Indomalaya and Australia.

orange.description: A citrus fruit known for its sweet taste and being a powerhouse of Vitamin C.
orange.history: The orange is a hybrid between pomelo and mandarin.

carrot.description: A root vegetable, typically orange in color.
carrot.history: Originally cultivated for its leaves and seeds in Persia.

tomato.description: A red, edible berry, commonly used as a vegetable in cooking.

spinach.description: A leafy green flowering plant packed with nutrients.
spinach.history: Famously associated with strength thanks to the cartoon character Popeye.

cabbage.description: A leafy vegetable grown for its dense-leaved heads.
cabbage.history: A staple in many cuisines, it has been cultivated for thousands of years.

capsicum.description: A type of large bell pepper, known for its mild flavor and vibrant colors.
capsicum.history: Native to the Americas, spread by Spanish and Portuguese explorers.

cauliflower.description: A cruciferous vegetable whose name is from Latin caulis (cabbage) and floris (flower).
cauliflower.history: It gained popularity in France in the 16th century.

chilli pepper.description: The fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, known for its spiciness.
chilli pepper.history: Part of the human diet in the Americas since at least 7500 BC.

lemon.description: A species of small evergreen trees known for its sour juice.
lemon.history: The lemon is a hybrid of bitter orange and citron.

onion.description: A vegetable that is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium.
onion.history: Used for thousands of years as a food ingredient.

potato.description: A starchy root vegetable native to the Andes in South America.
potato.history: Introduced to Europe in the 16th century by the Spanish.
